title: Leaked footage shows sickening moment a male Republic Airways crew member attacks female colleague
text:
Leaked surveillance footage shows the shocking moment a male Republic Airways employee spits and then punches a female colleague twice in a violent attack.

The short clip, obtained exclusively by FlyerTalk, was captured on September 14, shortly after a Republic Airways flight landed at Denver Airport as part of a layover.

A male member of the flight crew is seen walking down the jet bridge back towards the aircraft when he turns sharply and appears to spit at a female colleague, who was following close behind.

In response, the woman slaps the man across the face as he continues to advance towards her.

The Denver Police Department confirmed both people in the video were arrested for domestic violence assault, TMZ reports.

It’s unclear what happened immediately after the video. The incident occurred during a layover and no passengers were aboard the plane at the time.

A male member of the flight crew is seen walking down the jet bridge back towards the aircraft when suddenly he turns sharply on his haunches and appears to spit at a female colleague. She slaps him, prompting him to lunge at the woman

The man then lunges for the woman, causing her to flinch as he punches her once in the stomach, before delivering a second fearsome blow to the side of her head

The man then lunges for the woman, causing her to flinch as he punches her once in the stomach, before delivering a second blow to the side of her head.

The woman clutches the side of her face in pain, before pulling out her cell phone to call for help.

Both of the employees were arrested. The flight was eventually delayed until the following day.

The security footage was shared with FlyerTalk by an individual investigating the incident who wished to remain anonymous.

In a statement, Republic Airways acknowledged the incident and said both of the parties involved were fired shortly afterwards

The incident happened at Denver Airport (pictured) on September 14

In a statement, Republic Airways acknowledged the incident and said both of the parties involved were fired shortly afterwards.

‘We are aware of a situation that occurred last month involving two of our employees,’ a spokesperson said.

‘We investigated this matter and took appropriate action consistent with our belief that such behavior is unacceptable. These individuals are no longer employed at Republic.’

At the time of the violent altercation, Republic Airways had been operating the flight as part of a codeshare with United Airlines.
